ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organization achieved in multi dimentional activities, such as healath and family welfare with the implementation of Projects i.e. Reproductive and Child Health under NRHM as field NGO, Targeted Intervention Project on HIV/AIDS with Female Sex Workers in the district of Sivasagar whrere total 8 numbers of HIV positive people have been provided with required care and services, STI Management, Condom Promotion and empowering the High Risk Groups with the help of Behaviour Change Comunication and providing regular services of STI Management through NGO Clinics. The NGO has the large experience of forming SHGs in the village areas where nearly 600 numbers of SHGs are registered under the organization out of which total 223 numbers of SHGs have linked with various financial organization for their fututr sustainability. All existing SHGs are involved in various income generating activities such as handloom, handicrfats, Muga Silk rearing and reeling activities, Piggery farming, pisciculture, composite farming activities with the NGO support programe. The NGO has been implementing projects supported by NABARD, KVIC, Development Comisioner (Handicrafts), Assam State AIDS Control Society, Central Social Welfare Board etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SILPA KANON -Established in 2006 with a workshop of drama organized by National School of Drama, New Delhi. Organized two more drama workshop in collaboration with National School of Drama in 2007 &2008 in Nagaon. Organized folk dance workshops and Mask making workshops every year from 2008 to till date. Organized drama workshops for young artiste and children workshops on acting, painting and drawing every year from 2008 to till date. participated in Jashn-e- Bachpan with drama called Kazirangat Hahakar in 2009 Organized by TIE Company National School of Drama. Participated in Bal Sangam with dance program organized by TIE Company, National School of Drama for two times in the year 2007, 2008. Participated in national theater festival in Patna,Bihar(2012)with the play Prem Bine Nahi Dharma Aan, Participated in National Theatre festival podi Garhwal, uttarakhand (2007) with the play Jerengar Sati. Inviting regularly Aakar kala Sangam, New Delhi to perform their new plays in Nagaon (Assam) from 2010 to till date every year. Plays called Aur Agle Saal, Aath Ghante, Sonata, Saari Raat, Marnoprant etc. Silpa Kanon organized a Festival called â€œShaishavar Drishti reâ€ in 2008 (own plays festival) The Chief of Silpa Kanon Dakshina Sharma is an alumni of national School of Drama (2002) and the Chairman of Silpa Kanon, Mr. Suman Vaidya is also an alumni of NAtional School of Drama (1996). The Chief of Silpa Kanon Dakshina Sharma has received Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar of Sangeet Natak Akademi in 2010. In 2016 Silpa Kanon organized a 30 days theatre workshop (production oriented) in may 2016 play called Sonar Anguthi Directed by Dakshina Sharma. Some important Plays presented by Silpa Kanon â€“ Jyotir Jolongar Emuthi, Ram Bijoy, Kaziranga Hahakar, Swapnor Jagat, Kathgharat Bhagwan, Dusari Duniya, Amak Kheliboloi Dia, Upahar ne Binimay, Boroxun, Jerengar Sati, Rupalim, Lobhita, Sonit Kuwari, Karengor Ligiri, Nimati Koina, Sonar Anguthi, Rati Puwabar Hole, Bhagwadajjukam etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sishu Bikash Kendra ( SBK) , through its creche and Preschool (ECCE program) has so far provided to at least 1500 parents / gaurdians for their children, comprehensive affordable services in childcare, health, nutrition, play and early learning within a protective and enabling environment. [1] Early Childcare service - The creche is safe and secure with biometric monitoring with Caregiver to children ratio as 8:55. Pest control, fire safety measures, clean eco-friendly spacious campus are all part of the facilities provided. [2] Early Childhood Health Service- SBK has being providing periodical medical health check up to the children of the creche and preschool by qualified doctors. [3] Early Childhood Education Service- SBK through its preschool has being providing early education to the children from the society primarily by adopting a combination of Montessori, Play-Based and other prevalent curriculum of Preschool teaching. [4] Socio-economic welfare Benefits: SBK, has being providing training and generating employment for unskilled/unskilled workers, caregivers (aayas) and preschool educators. [5]Training Benefits to trainees under various Childcare and Education Programs- SBK has being facilitating "Orientation Visits" and "Practical Classes" to various trainees undertaking Training and Courses in ECCE programs under different institutions such as DispurCollege, Handique College (both affiliated to Gauhati University), Indian Council of Child Welfare, Regional Colege of Nursing, Guwahati , Govt of Assam. Since its 22 years of existence SBK has being working on the basis of some of the best recommendations of Ministry of Women & Child Development, Govt of India ECCE Policy, ICDS objectives Directorate of Social Welfare, Govt of Assam and Early Childhood Development (ECD) objectives of UNICEF.

ngoList.title: Social Unity Keeper Association For All SUKAFA
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Social Unity Keeper Association For All (SUKAFA) is a socio-economic development organization of Assam which is working for the upliftment of the underprivileged and weaker section of the society from the time of its inception. Major activity of the organization includes various social issues of concern from the grass root level. From policy formulation with the help of surveys, the organization tries to mobilize the masses in various socio-economic issues of great relevance in day to day affair. The vision of the society is to provide wellbeing to the entire society as a whole in general and to safeguard the interest of the poor, innocuous, destitute, downtrodden, oppressed and needy masses irrespective of sex, caste, creed, communities and religion in particular and the society will work as a charitable organization for the benefit of the rural people. The major activities performed by the organization includes various Awareness Campaigns, Street Plays, Blood Donation Camps, Surveys, Seminars and other public and civic issues. The organization has the experience of working with various prestigious Government Departments and Associations such as Assam State AIDS Control Society, Public Health Engineering Department, Govt. of Assam, Water and Sanitation Support Organization, Assam, Director of Information and Public Relation, Govt. of Assam, Sarva Siksha Abhiyan Kamrup, PRATHAM NGO from New Delhi etc.
